Prompt.pre_question_prompt: I am an expert of vaccine. I will ask some questions to collect information and then I will use the information to generate a story to encourage everyone to get vaccinated.
Prompt.task_specific_prompt: Write a story that can encourage everyone to get vaccinated using the questions and answers above. Include the benefits of vaccine in the story.

QApair.Question: Why are vaccines important?
QApair.Answer: Vaccines are important because they help protect people from diseases. Vaccines work by injecting a person with a “dead” or “modified” form of the virus. As that person's immune system fights off the “dead” virus, the immune system is also preparing to fight the live, or actual, virus. If you are ever exposed to the disease, your immune system is primed and ready to fight it off, because it has done so before.

QApair.Question: What are the risks of not being vaccinated?
QApair.Answer: The risks of not being vaccinated are that you are more susceptible to contracting the disease. Vaccines help prepare your immune system in advance so that if you are ever exposed to the disease, your body is more likely to fight it off.

QApair.Question: What are the risks of getting vaccinated?
QApair.Answer: There are always risks associated with any medical procedure, including vaccinations. However, the risks of getting vaccinated are far outweighed by the risks of not being vaccinated. Vaccines are safe and effective, and they help protect people from diseases.

QApair.Question: What should I do if I have questions about vaccines?
QApair.Answer: If you have questions about vaccines, you should speak to your healthcare provider. They will be able to give you the most accurate and up-to-date information about vaccines.

QApair.Answer: There can be side effects associated with any medical procedure, including vaccinations. However, the side effects of vaccines are usually minor and go away on their own.

QApair.Question: What are the most common side effects of vaccines?
QApair.Answer: The most common side effects of vaccines are mild and include things like pain at the injection site, redness, and swelling. These side effects are usually temporary and go away on their own.

QApair.Question: How can I reduce my risk of side effects from vaccines?
QApair.Answer: There is no guaranteed way to prevent side effects from vaccines, but there are some things you can do to reduce your risk. Make sure to drink plenty of fluids and get rest after you receive a vaccine. You should also avoid alcohol for 24 hours after you receive a vaccine.

QApair.Answer: Yes, you should get vaccinated if you're pregnant. Pregnant women are at an increased risk for some diseases, so it's important to get vaccinated to help protect yourself and your baby.

QApair.Answer: Yes, you should get vaccinated if you have a chronic illness. People with chronic illnesses are at an increased risk for some diseases, so it's important to get vaccinated to help protect yourself.
